In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure! Here's how you might write this function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    lines = []
    
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        
        line *= "$word "
    end
    
    if !isempty(line)
        push!(lines, line)
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Here is an example usage:

```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer id varius nisi. Suspendisse in lacinia sapien. Proin nec luctus sem."
text_width = 20
println(wrap_string(str, text_width))
```

This function will break the input string into lines such that each line is no longer than `text_width` characters (defaulting to 10 if not specified). Each word in the input string is added to a new line whenever adding it would exceed this limit.
